video.title: Global Spyware Scandal: Exposing Pegasus Part One (full documentary) | FRONTLINE

timeline_events.event_description: NSO Group was founded by three individuals.
A list of approximately 50,000 phone numbers, suspected to be targets of Pegasus spyware, was created or collected over this period.
involved_entities: Unnamed entities suspected of using Pegasus

timeline_events.event_description: The collection of the suspected Pegasus target list concludes around this time, encompassing numbers from 2016-2020.
involved_entities: Unnamed entities suspected of using Pegasus

timeline_events.event_description: Forbidden Stories, in collaboration with other partners, held a significant meeting in Paris during the COVID crisis to plan the global investigation into Pegasus spyware.
The publication date for the collaborative 'Global Spyware Scandal, Exposing Pegasus' investigation was set.
The 'Global Spyware Scandal, Exposing Pegasus' investigation, a two-part series, was published, revealing findings from the collaborative effort.

temporal_patterns.description: The consistent use of Pegasus spyware to monitor and track journalists, human rights activists, and dissidents across the globe, indicating a widespread and ongoing surveillance practice.
temporal_patterns.significance: Highlights the persistent nature and global reach of surveillance by states using Pegasus.

temporal_patterns.description: NSO Group's progression from its stated ambition to 'make the world a safer place' to developing powerful spyware now described as a 'military weapon used against civilians'.
temporal_patterns.significance: Illustrates a shift in the perceived or actual use-case and impact of the technology over time.

temporal_patterns.description: The observation that technology (specifically Pegasus spyware) is advancing much faster than government regulation and public understanding, leading to a persistent gap.
temporal_patterns.significance: Explains the challenges in controlling and comprehending sophisticated cyber surveillance capabilities.

temporal_patterns.description: The collaborative shift in journalistic practice from traditional competition to widespread partnership, involving over 80 journalists from various news organizations, to investigate complex stories like the Pegasus scandal.
temporal_patterns.significance: Demonstrates an evolution in how major investigations are conducted, moving towards greater inter-organizational cooperation.
temporal_patterns.timespan: Leading up to and during the 2020-2021 investigation

temporal_patterns.description: NSO Group's repeated claims that it sells software only to governments for 'legitimate purposes' like fighting terrorism, and its assertion of due diligence mechanisms to prevent misuse.
temporal_patterns.significance: Represents the company's consistent public stance and operational protocols regarding its product's intended use.

temporal_patterns.description: The systematic process of identifying individuals from raw phone numbers on a leaked list, involving extensive journalistic and technical collaboration.
temporal_patterns.significance: Highlights the methodical and complex nature of uncovering surveillance targets from technical data.
